Title: Staff Environmental Specialist - Primoris Renewable Energy
Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:
The Staff Environmental Specialist will work under the supervision of the Sr. Environmental Engineer to support environmental compliance within the business unit – both during the pre-construction phase and the operations phase of projects. This position is responsible for assisting the Sr. Environmental Engineer and Environmental Compliance Specialist in the development and deployment of policies and programs to various projects nationwide.
This position is primarily focused on the preparation of the Spill Prevention, Control, and Countermeasure (SPCC) Plan and the Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plan (SWPPP) for projects. Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to, supporting SPCC and SWPPP implementation; Threatened and Endangered species implementation, Air Permitting implementation, recycling and waste disposal and sustainability innovation at project sites, and pre-construction support for proposal efforts.
They must have the ability to listen and build relationships with various employees including estimating, procurement, and project operations teams as well as client representatives. This position requires the capability of travel to project sites on a monthly basis, as needed.
PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
The Staff Environmental Specialist will support environmental related aspects of multiple projects, as required by federal, state, and local regulations during both the pre-construction and construction phase of solar projects. The primary focus of the position is SPCC and SWPPP preparation and compliance including the ability to evaluate and propose BMPs as needed based on site visits and review of provided engineering drawings. Typical responsibilities include:
Preparation of SPCC Plans for upcoming projects under the guidance of the Sr. Environmental Engineer.
Preparation of SWPPP narratives for upcoming projects under the guidance of the Environmental Compliance Specialist and Sr. Environmental Engineer.
Review and redline of Erosion and Sediment Control Plans provided by the Engineer of Record, including site visits to identify potential areas of concern prior to mobilization of the construction team.
Site visits to projects to ensure that the site SWPPP BMPs are being implemented as anticipated.
Build and maintain a BMP cost/use matrix with the guidance of the Sr. Environmental Engineer, Environmental Compliance Specialist, and Procurement group for use during proposals and operations.
Review due diligence documentation provided during the RFP and provide stormwater BMP take offs with the guidance of the Sr. Environmental Engineer.
Additional tasks and trainings as assigned by the Environmental Compliance Specialist or the Sr. Environmental Engineer.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Science/Engineering or related degree or equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
Minimum 3 years progressive environmental experience.
Prior stormwater experience and stormwater training such as CISEC, CQIS, QPSWPPP, or CSI-Construction or the ability to obtain.
Valid driver’s license and an acceptable motor vehicle driving record (MVR).
HAZWOPER 40-hour or ability to obtain
Travel up to 25% of the time is required.

Benefits:
Paid Company Holidays
Paid Sick Leave
Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA/HSA, Short Term/Long Term Disability, 401K with matching contribution
Salary $80,000 - $100,000 annually dependent on experience, qualifications and competencies
REQUIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES:
Interpersonal skills – Ability to present information to a small group of employees or sub-contractors.
Effective communication skills (oral, written, listening, presentation) to effectively work with employees and subcontractors.
Computer literacy. This does not include knowledge of all software to be used, but the ability to learn to use efficiently the software which is in use. Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, Visio).
Organization skills. Scheduling, planning and prioritization.
Intermediate construction drawing knowledge. Knowledge of drawing layouts, references, notes, and good practices associated with producing and reading construction drawings.
Ability to follow safety rules without cutting corners. To understand the intent of safety rules, not blindly adhering to the literal words of the rule.

Title: Part-Time Environmental Health Specialist
Job Description:
Maintains detailed computer records and organized document files for all activities as required.

Inspects food service establishments according to a regular schedule or in response to public complaint, reviewing potential health violations and hazards; checking internal food and equipment temperatures, food sources/labeling/condition, and staff hygiene; checking/advising personnel on proper sanitation, food handling, chemical storage, and rodent/insect control; occasionally collecting samples; and taking appropriate action to ensure compliance with all requirements, such as serving violation notices, and conducting administrative hearings and follow-up inspections to ensure compliance with orders.

Reviews plans for new or remodeled food establishments for code compliance, communicating possible violations, and making recommendations as needed. Inspects sites in processing applications for food service permits, and issues permits as appropriate; renews permits annually. Periodically inspects mobile/temporary food vendors, such as at fairs and festivals, and collects and receipts fees.

Reviews and processes applications for residential septic system permits, including performing feasibility analyses with property owners and soil scientists at proposed sites, researching property records, analyzing/interpreting soil reports and topography, reviewing installation plans, determining appropriate locations and types of permits according to state and local codes, and explaining/mailing procedures and requirements to property owners. Issues permits, enters on computer, and conducts on-site inspections during and after construction to ensure continuing compliance, issuing stop work orders for non-compliance as needed.

Investigates complaints of illegal septic discharge or malfunction, including inspecting sites, conducting dye tests to determine flow source, collecting/submitting samples, and discussing resolution of problems with property owners.

Reviews and processes applications for well permits, including reviewing site plans, determining appropriate locations according to state and local codes, entering on computer, issuing permits, inspecting placement and grading after construction, and taking/processing water samples. Sends notices of unsatisfactory water to property owner as needed.

Inspects public and semi-public swimming pools to ensure compliance with local/state/federal standards for water chemistry/quality and safety, including inspecting pool sites, checking safety devices, reviewing operating records and water sampling results, using test kit to evaluate chemical concentrations in the water, and initiating action to resolve problems.

Receives and investigates complaints regarding water quality, open dumping and burning, rodent and insect infestations, unsanitary/unsafe housing conditions, child welfare, hazardous waste sites, weeds, trash, and air quality. Prepares and mails code violation notices to property owners, responds to inquiries, and conducts follow-up inspections to ensure compliance.

Periodically works with County Attorney, and testifies in legal proceedings as required.

Serves as resource to the public regarding various environmental health issues, responding to inquiries/concerns by telephone and in office, preparing/providing printed materials, and occasionally attending meetings and/or making presentations to community groups, such as food service personnel, pool operators, septic and well installers, and property owners.

Periodically responds to hazardous waste spills, including assisting in identifying hazardous materials, securing the area, evacuating the public as needed, ensuring appropriate local/state/federal agencies are notified, and ensuring spills are properly removed.

Maintains current knowledge of environmental health issues and regulations by periodically attending seminars and meetings.

Serves on 24-hour call rotation for public health emergencies.

Performs related duties as assigned.

I. JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Baccalaureate Degree in environmental health, environmental science, food science, agronomy, or related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Possession of or ability to obtain certification as a registered environmental health specialist, certified pool operator, certified pest control operator, hazardous materials specialist, and standardized retail food inspector.

Working knowledge of and ability to enforce state and local environmental health codes, including septic and well systems, solid waste disposal, food service and swimming pool operations, housing standards, and communicable disease and vector control.

Ability to conduct effective investigations, and inspect sites for potential code violations, including collecting/recording/analyzing data and test samples, maintaining accurate records, preparing reports, making relevant arithmetic calculations, interpreting technical documents, such as construction plans, soil profiles, and topographic maps.

Ability to properly operate various instruments and equipment, such as computer, printer, calculator, level, hand auger, soil and tile probes, tape measure, chemical test kits, engineering rulers, light meter, and thermometers.

Ability to use appropriate universal health and safety precautions to avoid contamination/infection in high-risk environments.

Ability to work on several tasks at the same time, sometimes under time pressure, and complete assignments effectively amidst frequent distractions and interruptions.

Working knowledge of standard English grammar, spelling, and punctuation, and ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing with co-workers, other County departments, related state agencies, septic system contractors, well drillers, soil scientists, property owners, food service personnel, and the public, including being sensitive to professional ethics, gender, cultural diversities and disabilities.

Ability to understand and follow written and oral instructions/directions, and appropriately respond to constructive criticism.

Ability to competently serve the public with diplomacy and respect, including occasional encounters with irate/hostile persons.

Ability to comply with all employer/department personnel policies and work rules, including, but not limited to, attendance, safety, drug-free workplace, and personal conduct.

Ability to work alone and with others in a team environment, and maintain appropriate, respectful interrelationships with co-workers.

Ability to provide public access to or maintain confidentiality of department information/records according to state requirements.

Ability to occasionally work extended, evening and/or weekend hours, and occasionally travel out of town for conferences and training, sometimes overnight.

Ability to serve on 24-hour call rotation, and respond swiftly, rationally and decisively to public health emergencies.

Possession of a valid Indiana driver's license, and demonstrated safe driving record.

As a result of the duties associated with this job, there is the potential of becoming exposed to blood borne pathogens and other potentially infectious diseases. To safeguard employees and eliminate the liability placed on Hamilton County, employees working in this position shall begin the three shot Hepatitis B vaccination and subsequent training within 10 days of their initial job assignment per OSHA 29 CFR 1910.1030(f)(2)(i). The initial and two subsequent vaccinations shall be administered by the Hamilton County Health Department and free of charge to the employee. If the employee has previously received the three shot Hepatitis B vaccination, official documentation must be provided to the supervisor identifying the dates in which each shot was appropriately administered. A Temporary Medical Declination may be made for a period of up to six months. A Declination form must be completed, outlining the medical reasons for the temporary declination and forwarded to the Safety & Risk Manager. Employees temporarily declining the vaccine are prohibited from performing any duties in which they may be exposed to a blood borne pathogen or other potentially infectious disease until they are able to begin/continue the series of vaccinations. Failure to comply will result in termination of employment.

II. DIFFICULTY OF WORK:

Incumbent's duties are broad in scope and of substantial intricacy, involving many variables or considerations with interrelationships that are not clearly evident. Incumbent performs according to well-defined legal requirements and department policies and procedures, exercising independent judgement in applying guidelines and technical knowledge to specific cases and circumstances.

III. RESPONSIBILITY:

Incumbent applies standardized practices to specific cases, referring to supervisor unusual or unprecedented situations as needed. Incumbent receives indirect or occasional supervision, with work reviewed primarily for attainment of and effect on department goals/objectives.

IV. PERSONAL WORK RELATIONSHIPS:

Incumbent communicates regularly with co-workers, other County departments, related state agencies, property owners, food service personnel, septic system contractors, soil scientists, well drillers, and the public, for purposes of exchanging information, explaining/interpreting policies and procedures, resolving problems, and persuading code violators to implement corrective procedures.

Incumbent reports directly to Director of Environmental Health.

V. PHYSICAL EFFORT AND WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Incumbent performs duties in a variety of settings, including a standard office environment, food establishments, at swimming pools, outdoors, at construction sites, in/around concrete septic tanks, and in a vehicle. Duties may involve standing/walking for long periods, sitting and walking at will, walking on uneven terrain, speaking clearly, keyboarding, pushing/pulling/lifting/carrying objects weighing under 50 pounds, crouching/kneeling, bending, reaching, color and depth perception, hearing sounds/communication, close and far vision, handling/grasping/fingering objects, and exposure to inclement weather, dust, dirt, odors, sewage gases, heavy machinery, toxic chemicals, and communicable diseases. Universal health and safety precautions must be followed at all times to avoid infection and injury to self and others.

Incumbent occasionally works extended, weekend and/or evening hours, and occasionally travels out of town for conferences and training, sometimes overnight.

Lead the coordination efforts with outside environmental consultants as necessary to ensure timely report submission and environmental compliance.
Conduct environmental audits and assessments.

COMPANY OVERVIEW
Dessert Holdings (DH) is North America’s fastest growing premium dessert company, recognized for providing retail and foodservice customers with chef-inspired innovative desserts made with real ingredients, a flexible and low-cost supply chain, and best in class service. Based in St. Paul, Minnesota, it is a collection of premium dessert companies and brands: The Original Cakerie, Lawler’s Desserts, Atlanta Cheesecake Company and most recently Steven Charles - A Dessert Company. Dessert Holdings was purchased by Bain Capital and is continuing its journey of rapid growth. Dessert holdings has over 2,700 team members spanning five states in the U.S. and Canada.
THE POSITION
This role is responsible for the day-to-day safety initiatives in our facility located in Humble, Texas, supporting our Kennesaw, Georgia facility. The EHS Specialist reports directly to the Senior Health & Safety Manager and will be required to promote safety attitudes, safe work practices and environments as well as manage, maintain, and administer the EHS program with the objective of minimizing accidents, injuries and environmental impact
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
· Advises and assists managers and supervisors in promoting a safe work environment.
· Ensures compliance with federal and state regulations by understanding existing laws and rules, interpreting standards, enforcing adherence, and advising management on needed actions
· Acts as an internal resource for incident investigation using root cause analysis.

· Coordinates emergency evacuation drills and any other compliance practices
· Collaborate by sharing best practices with other DH facilities and support the execution of initiatives
· Performs safety compliance inspections including hazard analysis, Risk assessments, safe work procedures, written reports, and recommendations.
· Leads others directly and indirectly to enhance safety culture
· Responsible for monitoring adherence to the company safety program by all Dessert Holdings employees and contractors
· Work collaboratively with all stakeholders to ensure health and safety concerns are addressed and resolved in a timely manner
· Follow-up on open action items, legislative requirements, and support the implementation of corrective actions
· Partners with Human Resources in workers compensation management
· Understand OSHA record keeping requirements. Responsible for completing and submitting OSHA compliance reports (300, 300A logs, injury reports, etc)
· Assists in the processing, tracking, recording and reporting of accident and incident data
· Leads the health and safety committees
· Develop site specific training materials and executes safety training to include OSHA compliance programs
· Create/conduct inspection schedules and follow up on corrective actions
· Other duties related to maintaining a safe work environment as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:
A minimum of Bachelor’s degree or technical training in any safety-related field
· A professional designation (e.g. CSP) is an asset
· Thorough knowledge and understanding of OSHA regulations, and occupational health and safety standards (ANSI, etc.)
· Strong communication skills (both verbal and written) to be an effective influencer at all levels and display effective leadership skills
· Proficiency with database applications and administration systems, specifically Microsoft office
· Effective organizational skills
· Must be a HIGHLY MOTIVATED, service and team-oriented individual with an attention to detail effective managing self with little supervision – self driven.
· At least 3 years of experience supporting Safety in a manufacturing setting

Title: Environmental Compliance Specialist
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:
This opportunity is for a flexible and self-motivated individual. You will be responsible for managing project delivery as well as assisting with Spill Prevention, Control, and Countermeasure (SPCC) Plan preparation, auditing and regulatory compliance projects & environmental due diligence for mergers and acquisitions. Preferred skillset also includes familiarity with the development and preparation of Facility Response Plans (FRP). If hired, you can expect up to 40 % short-term and extended travel.
Typical responsibilities will include:
Due Diligence support for mergers and acquisitions, including ASTM Phase I environmental site assessments.
Leverage knowledge of environmental SPCC requirements and other regulatory compliance programs to develop and prepare plans.
These comprehensive plans outline both the containment and countermeasures implemented to prevent a spill from occurring. The plans also contain response procedures should a spill occur and other critical elements. SPCC plans are prepared to be consistent with current regulation.
Assistance with multimedia permitting (air, water, waste) and compliance efforts, including on-site environmental, health and safety (EH&S) compliance support at client facilities for:
Permitting, sampling, and reporting efforts
Classification, inventory, and handling of hazardous materials
Auditing regulatory compliance and management systems at the plant and corporate levels
Developing EH&S management training materials.
Regulatory research
Data handling and analysis
Travel and participation in field activities.
POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
Traits required for success in our team:
Flexibility and ability to manage multiple deadlines and fast-changing priorities
Display integrity through honesty, fairness, & respect
Possesses a sense of responsibility and takes accountability
Takes initiative
Maintains a sense of ownership over delivery of projects
Trustworthy & dependable
Good listener & fosters teamwork
Skills required for success in this role include:
3-5 years of direct experience in environmental compliance programs specific to preparing SPCC plans and other experience to include CAA, CWA, RCRA, CERCLA, and environmental due diligence, environmental compliance auditing and support, and related consulting with a solid foundation in technical and regulatory subject areas, specifically understanding of:
• U.S. federal and state environmental regulations (knowledge of state-specific and any international regulations a plus) • U.S. health, safety, and transportation regulatory programs •EHS management systems (e.g., ISO 14001) •Phase I Environmental Site Assessment (ASTM 1527-13 and ASTM 1527-21) •language and methods of M&A transactions and environmental due diligence •appropriate sampling techniques
EHS Support is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, and/or disability status.

Title: Environmental Compliance Specialist
Job Description:
GovTact is hiring a Senior Compliance Specialist to assist in providing analysis and administrative services in support of the Navy Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS) Compliance Program and the ODS Subcommittee of the Clean Air Act Services Steering Committee (CAA SSC), Navy Shipboard Environmental Protection Program, Navy Environmental Quality Programs and other emerging programs related to marine engine exhaust emissions: greenhouse gases (GHGs) and climate change.
This position will be based onsite in Bethesda, MD.
GovTact is willing and able to sponsor candidates for a DoD Secret Clearance in this position.
What You’ll Get to Do:
· Manage requests from the fleet for acquisitions and returns of ODS.
· Review, update and distribute Navy/USMC ODS Reserve Authorized Users List (AUL).
· Provide technical summaries for and participate in regular meetings of the CAA SSC.
· Collect information from major marine engine manufacturers as needed to support Navy ship design planning.
· Conduct studies on shipboard engine emissions and emission reduction technologies hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs) and other GHGs used In Navy and DoD applications.
· Provide technical support and assistance in program coordination within and outside the Navy, conducting analysis and impact assessment of domestic, international, European Union, and foreign national environmental treaties, laws, and regulations.
· Review, develop, and provide input to environmental awareness materials and training programs.
You’ll Bring These Qualifications:
· Ability to obtain and maintain a SECRET clearance.
· BS in Mechanical Engineering or related field and 5-7 years experience.
· Experience with the 1990 Clean Air Act Amendments (CAAA).
· Experience with Environmental Management, Pollution Prevention, Environmental Compliance, Environmental Conservation & Planning.
· Experience with reviewing environmental regulations to assess regulatory impacts on U.S. Navy activities and recommend compliance methodologies to meet the requirements of emerging environmental regulations.
These Qualifications Would Be Nice to Have:
· Experience with environmental compliance best management practices at the installation and provide technical support for corrective measures to ensure compliance with the requirements.
· Experience with developing air toxic control compliance plans, performance annual emission inventories, calculate emissions, gather air-quality throughput data, enter data into databases, and compile data for reports as required. Related duties include the periodic inspections, auditing of permitted facilities, and oversight of source testing.
